spanishExample: ¡Ay! Te dije que no hablé con él.
englishTranslation: Ouch! I told you I didn’t speak with him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablé: spoke, I spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

englishTranslation: (all of you) Enough! Don’t do such things!
Go ahead! Pass that thing!
Talk to me or I’ll leave!
vocabIncluded: irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
iré: "will go", "I will go" (Ir, future, 1st person)

englishTranslation: Let’s talk! I want you to talk to me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablemos: let's speak (Hablar, imperative, 1st person plural)
hables: speak, you speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: Hey! I want to see you!

spanishExample: ¡Hey! Quiero que hables con mi amigo.
englishTranslation: Hey! I want you to talk to my friend.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hables: speak, you speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Oh! Tengo que decir adiós ahora, ¡nos vemos!
englishTranslation: Oh! I have to say goodbye now, see you!
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

englishTranslation: How many books do you have?
Ah, I see; all right, see you!

spanishExample: Ah, cuanto menos hagas, menos tendrás.
englishTranslation: Ah, the less you do, the less you’ll have.
vocabIncluded: tendrás: "will have", "you will have" (Tener, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Ay, cuanto más haces, más pasa.
englishTranslation: Ouch, the more you do, the more happens.
vocabIncluded: pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: Enough, I wasn’t talking to you.
vocabIncluded: hablaba: was speaking, I was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Bueno, pero si hablo, no pasan tiempo conmigo.
englishTranslation: All right, but if I speak, they don’t spend time with me.
vocabIncluded: hablo: speak, I speak (Hablar, present, 1st person)
pasan: pass, they pass (Pasar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Bueno, quiero que pase tiempo conmigo.
englishTranslation: All right, I want her to spend time with me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pase: pass, he/she/it pass (Pasar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: The more he talks, the less he does.
vocabIncluded: habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Cuanto menos haces tu trabajo, menos lo hacen otras personas.
englishTranslation: The less you do your work, the less other people do it.

spanishExample: Dale, tenemos que hablar antes de que yo hable con él.
englishTranslation: Go ahead, we have to talk before I talk to him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
hable: speak, I speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 1st person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

englishTranslation: Hmm, she’ll talk about that.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablará: will speak, he/she/it will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Eh, no estoy seguro de que mis cosas estén ahí.
englishTranslation: Hmmm, I’m not sure that my things are there.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: En el pasado teníamos unos cuantos amigos.
englishTranslation: In the past we had a small number of friends.
He was talking that day.
vocabIncluded: hablaba: was speaking, he/she/it was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: We’re talking about that book.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablamos: speak, we speak (Hablar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Hablan de la familia del señor.
englishTranslation: They talk about the gentleman’s family.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hablan: speak, they speak (Hablar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: He hablado de cuantos libros él quería.
englishTranslation: I have talked about as many books as he wanted.
vocabIncluded: cuanto: "as much" or "as much as" (indefinite adjective)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

englishTranslation: Oh, they have as much food as they want.
vocabIncluded: cuanto: "as much" or "as much as" (indefinite adjective)

englishTranslation: Okay, I’ll give it to you!
vocabIncluded: daré: "will give", "I will give" (Dar, future, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

englishTranslation: Okay, how many do you want?

spanishExample: Pasará por tu casa y quiero que hable contigo.
englishTranslation: She’ll pass by your house and I want her to talk to you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hable: speak, he/she/it speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
pasará: will pass, he/she/it will pass (Pasar, future, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: Sorry, we didn’t speak that day.
vocabIncluded: hablamos: spoke, we spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Perdón, pero hablarás con ella aunque no quieras.
englishTranslation: Sorry, but you’ll talk to her even if you don’t want to.
vocabIncluded: hablarás: will speak, you will speak (Hablar, future, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: (Formal) Please put as much as you want.
vocabIncluded: cuanto used with a subjunctive to mean "as much as", as in “cuanto quiera” (pronoun)

spanishExample: Pues, claro, paso por ese lugar cada semana.
englishTranslation: Well, of course, I pass by that place each week.
vocabIncluded: paso: pass, I pass (Pasar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pues, ella siempre pone eso aquí.
englishTranslation: Well, she always puts that here.
vocabIncluded: pone: puts, he/she/it puts (Poner, present, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: They want as many things as they can have.
vocabIncluded: cuanto: "as much" or "as much as" (indefinite adjective)
puedan: "be able", "they be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Si pasas por mi casa, hablaremos de unas cuantas cosas.
englishTranslation: If you pass by my house, we’ll talk about a small number of things.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaremos: will speak, we will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person plural)
pasas: pass, you pass (Pasar, present, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: Yes, I’ll talk to you.
vocabIncluded: hablaré: will speak, I will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person)

englishTranslation: You always talk a whole lot.
vocabIncluded: hablas: speak, you speak (Hablar, present, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: She always spends time here.
vocabIncluded: pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tengo que irme ya, ¡así que adiós!
englishTranslation: I have to leave now, so goodbye!
vocabIncluded: irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things
